name: Bound
effect: You cannot use your Relocate Action, and receive a -2 to Move Rolls used with your Primary Action.

name: Fleeing
effect: A target that is running from you or an ally.  They are considered Flanked while fleeing.

name: Free Move
effect: You can move through enemy squares and over difficult terrain with no penalty.  Additionally, you cannot be the target of Opportunity Attacks.

name: Prone
effect: All Defence Move Rolls suffer a -3 Penalty.  Attacks against you deal +5 Bonus Verve Damage.  You can remove the Prone Status by sacrificing your Relocate Move.

name: Stunned
effect: Your vision is reduced to 6 squares, you lose 1 Action of your choice, and cannot perform Moves that require a Roll.    Any spell or psionic power that you have in effect dissapates immediately, and you can no longer maintain concentration.

name: Attribute Buffed
effect: An attribute is buffed.  All Skill Moves that you resolve with that Attribute gain a bonus.  See the effect for the bonus.

name: Bleeding
effect: You lose Verve for each sq you Move.  DC1 Bleeding is 1 Verve per sq, and so forth to DC5.

name: Blind
effect: You fail any check that requires sight, and reroll successful Move Rolls when seeing is important.

name: Burning
effect: Your target incurs 2 Verve Loss per round while burning.  They may expend a Relocate Move to put themselves out.

name: Cautious
effect: You are aware and cautious of all opponents.  When you are Cautious, opponents cannot use some Moves against you - such as Stealth, Subterfuge, moves under the Influence Skill, and the Grapple and Trip SubMoves.

name: Chilled
effect: Your target's Move sq. incurs a -1 Penalty.

name: Confused
effect: When attempting any Move, a Raw Value of 8- grants the DM the ability to choose a new target, or cancel the action.  If the Move does not require a Roll, you must Roll for the Raw Value.

name: Deaf
effect: You fail any check that requires hearing, and you reroll successful Move Rolls when hearing is important.  Additionally, you fail the Cast a Spell Move on a Raw Roll of 4-.

name: Decaying
effect: Your target incurs a -1 Penalty to the first Move they use each turn that uses a Physical Attribute.

name: Demoralised
effect: You lose 3 Verve each time you fail a Move, or when someone saves against one of your Moves.

name: Dissuaded
effect: The target will prefer not to take an action, such as Melee Attack or Ranged Attack.  If they ignore this preference, they incur a -1 Penalty to their roll, or a -2 to any application of Verve Loss.

name: Dying
effect: The target has taken too much damage and is bleeding out.  You may be able to resolve the Stabilise Move in the Rest Skill to save yourself.  If you have the Dying Status for three rounds, you perish from wounds and exhaustion.

name: Encouraged
effect: You Restore 2 Verve each time you succeed at a Move, even when resolving Basic Melee and Basic Ranged Attack.

name: Enraged
effect: The enraged target will aggressively approach and attack targets it considers their opponents, using only the Relocate and Attack Moves if it can unless unable to.

name: Fortified 10
effect: If you would ever take more than 10 damage from a single physical hit, reduce it to 10.

name: Fortified 5
effect: If you would ever take more than 5 damage from a single physical hit, reduce it to 5.

name: Frightened
effect: All Move Rolls suffer a -2 Penalty while you can perceive your source of fear.  You attacks automatically miss on a Raw Roll of 4-.

name: Gusted
effect: Your target incurs a -1 Penalty to Defence Moves against effects that try to Move them, as well as to the Athletics Move.

name: Hasted
effect: Your speed is multiplied by 1.5.  You gain 1 additional Primary, Relocate or Quick Action each turn.  When you leave Hasted, you gain the Stunned Status.

name: Inspired
effect: Roll an additional D4 on one Roll per turn.

name: Intimidated
effect: Your target prefers to avoid the target of their intimidation.  Targets automatically succeed at Defenses against it on a Raw Roll of 16+

name: Invisible
effect: You have Advantage on any creature that cannot perceive you with sight.

name: Melting
effect: Your target incurs 1 Verve Loss per round, and suffers a -1 Penalty to the Block Move.

name: Paralyzed
effect: You lose all your Actions.

name: Poisoned
effect: You lose Verve each turn.  The amount of Verve is based on the strength of the poison.  DC1 Poison applies 3 Verve Loss, DC2 applies 6, DC3 applies 10, DC4 applies 15, and DC5 applies 20.

name: Provoked
effect: Your target prefers to target the object / person they were provoked to.  If that would put them in danger, they may ignore this provocation.

name: Shocked
effect: You incur a -1 Penalty to the first Move they use each turn that uses a Mental Attribute.

name: Sickened
effect: You incur a -3 to all Rolls.

name: Slow
effect: Your speed is halved.  You lose an Action of your choice each turn.

name: Uplifted
effect: Reroll all failed Move Rolls once.

name: Charmed
effect: Unless they do anything to obviously break your trust, you consider the source of the Charm Effect as a friend.

name: Cursed
effect: Reroll all successful Move Rolls once.

name: Dazed
effect: Your vision is reduced to 6 squares and you lose 1 action of your choice.  You can maintain any effect that requires concentration for a maximum of 1 round.

name: Diseased
effect: You may have a physical or a mental disease, or both.  Whenever you perform a Move that has a class of attribute to which you are diseased, if you roll a low Raw Roll you gain the Exhausted Status.  DC 1 Diseases cause this effect on a Raw Roll of 2-.  DC 2 occurs on 3- and so on.  Rolling under the Raw Roll a second time also applies the Dazed Status.  Performing a Short Rest removes these Statuses.

name: Duelling
effect: You are locked into a duel with another combatant.  If you were the initiator, you gain the following bonuses: 1) If the Duelling recipient leaves your threatening area, you gain an Opportunity Attack, or may Resolve the Grapple or Trip Move as a Free Action.  2) You gain the bonuses of the Inspired Status for 1 roll while Duelling.  Duelists lose the Duelling Status if the recipient manages to leave your Threatening Area, or if you fail a Block, Dodge, or Resist roll against a target in melee combat.

name: Dumb
effect: You cannot use Moves that use a Mental Stat.

name: Encumbered
effect: Your movement speed is reduced by 1sq, and you get a -2 Penalty to Moves that use the Dex Attribute.

name: Exhausted
effect: You lose all current Stamina.  Your maximum Verve is reduced to 70% of the total, and you cannot gain more than that amount.

name: Flanked
effect: A character is Flanked if they do not have the Cautious Status, and are adjacent to 3 enemies or if 2 enemies are adjacent and on opposite sides of them.  Enemies: may be Backstabbed and you may use Stealth against them if they are not cautious of you.  Players: incur a -2 penalty to the Dodge move.

name: Flowing
effect: You Restore 2 Verve at the start of your turn.  You may end this effect at any time.  If you do, you resolve any Roll Twice and take the higher result, except when resolving Basic Melee or Basic Ranged Attack, which automatically converts your attack to a Critical Hit.  This Status is removed at the end of Combat.

name: Limited
effect: You may only engage up to 5 Points on any Point Track.

name: Sleeping
effect: Your target is slumbering soundly.  They wake with the Prone Status if struck, or if a loud noise occurs.  In combat, this is most often when melee attacks are made within 3 sq. of them, or a spell of DC3 or higher is cast.

name: Staggered
effect: Enemy sufferers lose their Primary Action and cannot use Special Attacks.  PC sufferers may not use Mods on Moves.  This Status may be removed by expending your Relocate Action, but the effect still applies on the turn you remove the Status.

name: Stealth
effect: You are unseen and unheard, and cannot be targeted by enemy Moves.

name: Terrified
effect: All Move Rolls suffer a -3 Penalty while you can perceive your source of fear or anything like it, and terrified targets will prefer to leave the presence of their source of terror.    You attacks automatically miss on a Raw Roll of 6-.

name: Vulnerable
effect: You receive 1.5x Verve loss, and any time you incur 10 or more Verve Loss, you also gain the Wound: Injured Status.

name: Weakened
effect: You cannot use Moves that use a Physical Stat.

name: Wound: Injured
effect: All Move Rolls are performed with a -1 penalty.

name: Wound: Scarred
effect: Any time you gain Verve, you only gain half and all Rolls are performed with a -1 penalty.

name: Wound: Mortal
effect: Any time you gain Verve, you only gain half.  All Rolls are performed with a -2 penalty and your movement is reduced by 1.
